intro: Brachyclados megalanthus, commonly known as the giant brachyclados, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. The plant has a woody stem with a distinctive branching pattern, and its leaves are typically narrow and leathery. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
